comments:
Driver:  WTP 2.0 200705230230

When resource overwrite or folder creation is not enabled and the Web services Ant task tries to write files or create folder, the commands report a warning.  The Ant task status handler AntStatusHandler) is ignoring the warning.  This caused problems in commands that got run afterwards.  For example, if folder creation is disabled and the user is not notified, then it's equivalent to cancelling the popup in the wizard.  Then when subsequent command tried to move the generated files, the user gets the error:

IWAB0523E Error moving resource: null
    java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.common.FileResourceUtils.makeFile(FileResourceUtils.java:579)
    at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.common.FileResourceUtils.createFileAtLocation(FileResourceUtils.java:708)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.consumption.core.command.WSDL2JavaCommand.moveGeneratedFiles(WSDL2JavaCommand.java:265)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.consumption.core.command.WSDL2JavaCommand.execute(WSDL2JavaCommand.java:219)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.creation.ui.command.TDCodeGenOperation$TopDownWSModifyOperation.execute(TDCodeGenOperation.java:138)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.axis.creation.ui.command.TDCodeGenOperation.execute(TDCodeGenOperation.java:89)
